p: Considering the concept of immune privilege and the high selectivity of the blood-placental, blood-testis, and blood–brain barrier to control protein and immune cell entry in the organs, the immune responses mediated by dendritic cells, M1/M2 macrophages, endothelial cells, and CD4 and CD8 lymphocytes reflect the complexity of the host defense system and its organization to combat infectious agents. 5– 7
